review_body: Had some problems getting it to work. The supplied cable was no good - would not charge the battery. When I replaced cable with my own was able to charge and then connect the device via bluetooth to a PC. Had trouble finding the PC software but when I emailed their support they responded within a day with the correct download info. PC program works well for testing the unit after you figure out which port to use (port 4 in my case). The accuracy and stability of the unit look very good for my application, however I was not able to connect to either an iPhone or iPad (tried several of each) via bluetooth. Will have to hard-wire if I decide to use this device in my product.
Response:
{'input': 'Had some problems getting it to work. The supplied cable was no good - would not charge the battery. When I replaced cable with my own was able to charge and then connect the device via bluetooth to a PC. Had trouble finding the PC software but when I emailed their support they responded within a day with the correct download info. PC program works well for testing the unit after you figure out which port to use (port 4 in my case). The accuracy and stability of the unit look very good for my application, however I was not able to connect to either an iPhone or iPad (tried several of each) via bluetooth. Will have to hard-wire if I decide to use this device in my product.', 'destination': 'support', 'language': 'en', 'text': '1. First, confirm that the supplied cable is not working by trying to charge the battery with a different cable.

2. If the cable is indeed faulty, replace it with a working cable to charge the battery.

3. Once the battery is charged, connect the device to a PC via Bluetooth. If you are having trouble finding the PC software, contact customer support via email.

4. Email customer support with your issue and wait for a response. They should provide you with the correct download information for the PC software.

5. Once you have downloaded the PC software, test the unit by connecting it to the PC. Make sure to use the correct port (port 4 in your case).

6. If the PC program works well and the unit is accurate and stable, but you are still unable to connect to an iPhone or iPad via Bluetooth, consider hard-wiring the device if you plan to use it in your product.'}
